channel.title: Peruvian on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Peruvian on Table41NYC

item.title: Chirp
item.description: The lomo saltado was ok. The sauces cost 60 cents extra.

item.title: Chimu Bistro
item.description: The ceviche was good, but the lomo saltado was surprisingly pretty good. Beef slices were tender.

item.title: Jora
item.description: It was ok. Meat was overly chewy and tough. Price wasn’t too bad.

item.title: Baby Brasa
item.description: The chicken was good, but it’s a little pricey though. Seems to be a common theme nowadays.

item.title: Llama Inn
item.description: This place was pretty good. It’s expensive sorta, but the lomo saltado was decent.

item.title: Riko Peruvian Cuisine
item.description: So bad. The lomo saltado is really dry. Can’t seem to find a decent lomo saltado in NYC.

item.title: Coppelia
item.description: “Gourmet” lomo saltado is like paying $20 tacos. This is a ripoff and not worth the $20+. Good, but not great.

item.title: Senor Pollo
item.description: This place is pretty cheap. I remember both the lomo and pollo being a bit on the dry side, but it’s so cheap not much of a reason to complain I guess.
